intro: Senecio durangensis, commonly known as the Durango groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Senecio durangensis produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
